newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt pound falls against dollar.
newsitem.headline: Egypt pound falls against dollar.

text.p: The Egyptian pound fell against the dollar on Sunday in a market still slightly short of the U.S. currency, bankers said.
"The market is still a little short of dollars. There is demand for the currency but there is no specific reason for the shortage," one banker said.
Four actively trading banks quoted the dollar at between 3.3910 and 3.3960 pounds bid and 3.3940 and 3.3975 pounds offered in the interbank market.
The average exchange rate was 3.394125 bid and 3.3960 offered compared to 3.3935 bid and 3.3957 offered on Thursday.
The Central Bank calculated the average rate at midday as 3.392424 pounds buy and 3.395570 pounds sell.
